intro: Jumellea penicillata, commonly known as the slender bottle tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, bottle-shaped trunk that stores water, aiding in its survival in arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant shrub that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Jumellea penicillata is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to withstand harsh conditions.
